meanings.definition: The act of changing the direction or focus of something.
meanings.sent1: Her reorientations in life led her to discover new passions.
meanings.sent2: The company's reorientations in marketing strategies boosted sales.
meanings.sent3: His constant reorientations in dance class made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The reorientations of the compass needle fascinated the children.
meanings.sent5: The reorientations of the furniture completely transformed the room.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting or adapting to a new situation or perspective.
meanings.sent1: After the move, she faced multiple reorientations in her daily routine.
meanings.sent2: The team underwent reorientations to meet the new project requirements.
meanings.sent3: The reorientations in his thinking made him see the world differently.
meanings.sent4: Her reorientations in problem-solving were like finding a new path in a maze.
meanings.sent5: The reorientations in technology constantly challenge our understanding.
